message_1: What is the period and amplitude of a gravitational wave signal detected by the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO) detector, given the strain amplitude and frequency of the detected signal?
message_2:
To determine the period and amplitude of a gravitational wave signal detected by LIGO, we need the strain amplitude (h) and frequency (f) of the detected signal.

The amplitude of the gravitational wave signal is equal to the strain amplitude (h). So, the amplitude is:

Amplitude = h

The period (T) of the gravitational wave signal is the inverse of the frequency (f). So, the period is:

Period (T) = 1 / f

Given the strain amplitude (h) and frequency (f) of the detected signal, you can now calculate the period and amplitude of the gravitational wave signal.
